notes: The health talent increases maximum health capacity, and keeps the current health percentage.
The projectile travels at a speed of 1200 and travels until reaching the targeted point.

Ice Shards are always created in the same formation. The shards' formation is a 200 radius circle with one open side, the center of the circle is 200 range before the targeted point. The first shard is always created at the targeted point, so it is always in one line with Tusk's position upon cast. The next shards are placed 40° further to the left and the right respectively, up to 7 shards. 9 shards would make a full circle. So the open side of the shards circle is always facing towards Tusk's position upon cast. The shards' collision radius is approximately 67, the distance between them is about 6, which is too small for any unit to move through.
The shards' formation is a 200 radius circle with one open side, the center of the circle is 200 range before the targeted point.
The first shard is always created at the targeted point, so it is always in one line with Tusk's position upon cast.
The next shards are placed 40° further to the left and the right respectively, up to 7 shards. 9 shards would make a full circle.
So the open side of the shards circle is always facing towards Tusk's position upon cast.
The shards' collision radius is approximately 67, the distance between them is about 6, which is too small for any unit to move through.

Units not controlled by any player do not try to path around the shards, but simply walk against them as if they are not there. This effectively causes them to get stuck until they change directions (e.g. when aggro-ing them), or until Ice Shards dissipates.
This effectively causes them to get stuck until they change directions (e.g. when aggro-ing them), or until Ice Shards dissipates.
The projectile has 100 radius flying vision. This vision lasts for 2 seconds at the targeted point upon reaching it.
abilities.description: Tusk compresses shards of ice into a ball of frozen energy that damages all enemies it comes in contact with. When the ball reaches its target destination the shards are released, creating a barrier that lasts for 4/5/6/7 seconds.
params: Pathing block affects spell immune units. Does not attempt to damage spell immune enemies.
abilities.story: In the frozen tundra near the Barrier, after the last sun of autumn has set, ice can form with alarming speed.

notes: The Snowball travels at a speed of 600/625/650/675.
The Snowball chases the target for up to 3 seconds, so it can travel for up to 1800/1875/1950/2025 range.

Tusk can Right Click allied heroes and clones to gather them into the Snowball at any point, even if they are invisible or invulnerable. Allies affected by Black Hole, Chronosphere, or Flaming Lasso cannot join the Snowball. However, attempting to load in an ally affected by these still adds damage to the Snowball. Can gather summoned units, including Frozen Sigil, but excluding other wards. Cannot gather allies who have ☐ Disabled Help from Tusk. Allies can Right Click the Snowball to jump inside as well.
Allies affected by Black Hole, Chronosphere, or Flaming Lasso cannot join the Snowball.
However, attempting to load in an ally affected by these still adds damage to the Snowball.
Can gather summoned units, including Frozen Sigil, but excluding other wards.
Cannot gather allies who have ☐ Disabled Help from Tusk.
Allies can Right Click the Snowball to jump inside as well.

Units inside Snowball are invulnerable, hidden and spell immune. Allies inside the Snowball are also fully disabled. Tusk himself is only muted and disarmed inside it, meaning he can cast his abilities, but cannot use items or attack.
Tusk himself is only muted and disarmed inside it, meaning he can cast his abilities, but cannot use items or attack.
Snowball's radius increases by 40 per second, starting immediately as it begins rolling, so the radius during each second is 240/280/320.
Only gathered allied heroes (including clones, excluding illusions and creep-heroes) increase its damage. Other added units do not.

Tusk cannot be forced out of the Snowball, while other units can still be forced out by teleporting abilities, without reducing the damage. Dark Rift is the only ability able to force Tusk out of the Snowball. Upon doing so, Snowball gets fully canceled.
Dark Rift is the only ability able to force Tusk out of the Snowball. Upon doing so, Snowball gets fully canceled.
When Snowball connects with its target, Tusk is given an attack order on the target, regardless of auto-attack settings.
The Snowball destroys trees within its radius as it rolls forward.

This is how much damage Snowball deals (before reductions) with a certain amount of heroes including Tusk: 1 Hero: 100/160/220/280 (TagTalent 220/280/340/400) 2 Heroes: 120/200/280/360 (TagTalent 240/320/400/480) 3 Heroes: 140/240/340/440 (TagTalent 260/360/460/560) 4 Heroes: 160/280/400/520 (TagTalent 280/400/520/640) Tusk himself is not counted, so if no allied heroes are gathered, only the base damage is applied.
Tusk himself is not counted, so if no allied heroes are gathered, only the base damage is applied.
Snowball first applies the debuff, then the damage.
A hidden debuff provides shared vision over the target until the Snowball stops. Does not provide True Sight.
abilities.description: Tusk begins rolling into a snowball. Allies within a 350 radius can also be added to the snowball by right-clicking on them, even while the snowball is moving. Once launched, any enemies caught in the snowball's path will be stunned and take damage. Each allied Hero in the snowball will add to its damage.
params: Cannot target spell immune enemies. Does not attempt to damage or stun spell immune enemies. Can pull spell immune allies inside.
abilities.story: Tales are still told of the wild feat that ended the grand brawl at White Fields.

notes: Replaces Snowball until the Snowball reaches its target or expires.
abilities.description: Launch the snowball toward the target.

notes: Interrupts Tusk's channeling abilities upon cast.
The aura's debuff lingers for 0.5 seconds.
Only triggers on allied hero attacks (including illusions and clones, excluding creep-heroes), and on any attacks done by units owned by Tusk.

The damage is directly added to the triggering unit's attack damage, so it works with crit, cleave and lifesteal. However, it is added as a raw damage bonus, so illusions cannot use it, and it is unaffected by percentage-based damage bonuses or reductions.
However, it is added as a raw damage bonus, so illusions cannot use it, and it is unaffected by percentage-based damage bonuses or reductions.
The slow from multiple attacks fully stacks, with each attack placing a separate debuff.
Attacks triggering Tag Team first place the slow debuff, then apply the attack damage.
abilities.description: Temporarily applies a negative debuff aura around you, causing enemies that are attacked under it to take bonus physical damage and reduced movement speed. Lasts 5 seconds.
params: Slow persists if debuff was placed before spell immunity.
abilities.story: Even far from Cobalt, Tusk carries the 'Barrier Chill' in his very bones.

notes: Requires Aghanim's Scepter to be unlocked. In Ability Draft, Walrus Kick can be unlocked by the player that drafted Walrus PUNCH!.
In Ability Draft, Walrus Kick can be unlocked by the player that drafted Walrus PUNCH!.
Unlike Walrus Punch, Walrus Kick is not an active attack modifier.

Chooses the closest enemy unit within the search radius, kicking them towards the targeted point. Prioritizes heroes, illusions and clones over non-hero units. Treats creep-heroes as heroes. The target does not need to be in front of Tusk, it can be behind Tusk as well, as long as they are within the search radius. If no enemies are within range, the cooldown gets reset and the mana cost refunded. Cannot target ancient creeps.
Prioritizes heroes, illusions and clones over non-hero units. Treats creep-heroes as heroes.
The target does not need to be in front of Tusk, it can be behind Tusk as well, as long as they are within the search radius.
If no enemies are within range, the cooldown gets reset and the mana cost refunded.
Cannot target ancient creeps.
The target is moved away from Tusk in an arc 1400 range far and 360 range high. Walrus Kick cannot be overridden by any other forced movement.
Walrus Kick cannot be overridden by any other forced movement.
While in the air, other units may pass below the kicked unit.
The slow debuff is applied right upon cast, so the effective slow duration is 4 seconds since the target is stunned for 1 second.
The kick first applies the slow debuff, then the knockback debuff, then the damage.
Destroys trees within a 100 radius around the affected unit during the knockback.
abilities.description: Kicks the closest enemy unit in a targeted direction, stunning and damaging them.
abilities.story: Tusk may have made his name with his fists, but the wise enemy is wary of any and all limbs.

notes: Requires Aghanim's Shard to be unlocked.
Frozen Sigil spawns at Tusk's exact location.
After cast, the Sigil automatically follows Tusk, if no other order is given.
The slow is provided by an aura. Its debuff lingers for 25 seconds.
Can be gathered inside Snowball, even though it is a ward-type unit.
abilities.description: Summons a flying Sigil that slows enemy attack by -40% and movement speed by -40% for enemies within 650 radius. Lasts seconds. Cooldown: 30
params: Slow persists if debuff was placed before spell immunity.

notes: The cast range of Walrus Punch always equals the caster's attack range.
Despite being an active attack modifier, Walrus Punch does proc all on-cast effects like a regular ability.
Walrus Punch cannot miss to evasion and blindness.
The victim is hurled 650 range (1200 if lethal) into the air during the stun duration. The speed adapts to changed stun durations. Walrus Punch cannot be overridden by any other upward movement.
Walrus Punch cannot be overridden by any other upward movement.
While in the air, other units may pass below the punched unit.
The slow is applied right upon cast, so the effective slow duration is 2/3/4 seconds since the target is stunned for 1 second.
The punch first applies the knockback debuff, then the slow debuff, then the damage.
Tusk can punch everything, except wards, buildings, allied and own units.
Plays a sound as soon as the attack starts. The sound only stops playing upon landing the punch.
Can be cast on Roshan, but only the stun and slow are applied.

With the level 25 talent, Walrus PUNCH! gains a 12% chance to passively proc on regular attacks. These procs are independent from the cooldown, they do not trigger the cooldown and work while on cooldown. They do not cost mana or proc on-cast effects either. Increases Tusk's attack damage by an average of 30% (TagTalent 39.6%). When a passive punch procs during a manual cast or Autocast order, the proc takes priority, so that it does not go on cooldown or expend mana. The passive punches use pseudo-random distribution.
These procs are independent from the cooldown, they do not trigger the cooldown and work while on cooldown.
They do not cost mana or proc on-cast effects either.
Increases Tusk's attack damage by an average of 30% (TagTalent 39.6%).
When a passive punch procs during a manual cast or Autocast order, the proc takes priority, so that it does not go on cooldown or expend mana.
The passive punches use pseudo-random distribution.
abilities.description: Tusk connects with his mighty Walrus Punch, a critical strike so powerful it launches its victim into the air. The victim is slowed upon landing.
params: Grants a new ability: Walrus Kick.
Grants a new ability: Frozen Sigil.
The passive proc chance from the talent is not disabled.
abilities.story: It never matters who throws the first punch, only who throws the last.

description: Ymir, the Tusk, is a melee strength hero whose array of icy disables makes him a very strong team initiator and ganker. He has a damage nuke and a disable in Ice Shards, which lets him precisely place a barrier in an enemy's path, inhibiting their movement and blocking off their escape path. Should his teammates need help closing the distance to enemies, Tusk can assist them with Snowball, which surrounds Tusk and any nearby allies in a protective shell of snow as he rolls at a target enemy, damaging and stunning everything in its path. Once in a fight, Tusk also has the ability to Tag Team, which allows all nearby allies to slow enemies they attack with physical damage. His ultimate, Walrus PUNCH!, sends a target enemy flying with a mighty uppercut, stunning and disabling them while dealing a critical strike and slowing them upon landing for a moderate amount of time. A strong initiator and powerful brawler, the Terror from the Barrier should never be bet against in a fight, as he can put his foes down for the count with his unique assortment of spells and disables.
history: It had been a brawl to remember. There stood Ymir, the Tusk, the Terror from the Barrier, the Snowball from Cobalt, the only fighter to have bested the Bristled Bruiser in a fair fight, and now the last man standing in Wolfsden Tavern. What started as a simple bar bet of supremacy ended with four regulars, a blacksmith, and six of the Frost Brigade's best soldiers writhing against the shards and splinters of almost every bottle, mug, and chair in the building. The Tusk boasted and toasted his victory as he emptied his brew. No sooner had the defeated regained consciousness than the cries for double-or-nothing rang out. The Tusk was pleased at the prospect, but none could think of a bet bigger than the one he just conquered. Horrified at the damage to his tavern and desperate to avoid another brawl, the barkeep had an idea. As skilled as he was, Ymir had never taken part in a real battle, never tested himself against the indiscriminate death and chaos of war. He proposed a wager to the fighter: seek out the biggest battle he could find, survive, and win it for whichever side he chose. The stakes? The next round of drinks.
